result.execSummary:
Dontrell L Lovett was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Dontrell L Lovett was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
of remand.
  Defendant given copy of fugitive warrant, advised of rights by the Court and knowingly and voluntarily waived the right to a hearing.  Def remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant given copy of fugitive warrant, advised of rights by the Court and waived the right to a hearing.  Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Extradition hearing on July 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.

AMENDED CASH BOND
$2,000 per case
Trial Judge - Br 17

Defendant Dontrell L Lovett in court with attorney Patrick Schilling. Prosecuting Atty Paul W. Humphrey appeared for State of Wisconsin, along with DCSO Detective Cathy Kisow. Continued bail hearing. Arguments by ADA Humphrey for the cash bail to remain at $2500 cash. Response arguments by Atty Schilling, requesting the bail to be reduced to $500 cash. Statements by defendant. Statements by the court. Court ordered bail reduced to $2000 cash and any previously ordered bail conditions remain in effect.
Bail/bond hearing on May 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dontrell L Lovett in court with attorney Patrick Schilling. Prosecuting Atty Paul W. Humphrey appeared for State of Wisconsin, along with Deputy Cathy Keisow from the Dane Co Sheriff's Office. ADA Humphrey requests a 60 day extension to allow time for a governor's warrant to be prepared. Court granted 60 day extension as requested and set a bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Extradition hearing on May 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Trial Judge - Br 17  Extradition hearing scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant given copy of fugitive warrant and requested a hearing.
Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
